{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3486375,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T03:36:15.191Z","cooked":"

Per R803 pneumatic cylinder itself cannot be modified. However, if I am adding a shaft collar at the rod part of the cylinder, the cylinder itself isn‚Äôt modified as shaft collar can be installed without drilling. Will this be legal for competition use?

Screenshot 2025-01-17 at 22.25.441646√ó730 54.5 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T03:38:01.884Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":55,"reads":396,"readers_count":395,"score":344.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482423,"topic_slug":"shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal/482423/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3486381,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T03:40:36.019Z","cooked":"

I think it should be (just don‚Äôt use a set screw style as it will gall the rod)

A more ‚Äúsafe‚Äù or 100% legal option is to toss a spacer of the correct length on there if you want to limit the stroke length.

You can also attach a piece of pipe to the rear of the cylinder (I think the threads are 5/8" on 1" & 3/4" cylinders) to extend the rear mount point backwards.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T03:40:53.650Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":392,"readers_count":391,"score":138.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482423,"topic_slug":"shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Flyin' a hull |5934‚Üê2451‚Üê2767‚Üê876"},"post_url":"/t/shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal/482423/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3486390,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T03:47:35.723Z","cooked":"

The point for the shaft collar is for it to be adjustable in comparison to other solutions you have here. While I think those spacers are more robust, they lack the ability of being adjusted without removing a whole lot of stuff. However, I do think a damping valve is needed if this method is used to reduce the stress on shaft collar.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T03:48:16.457Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":370,"readers_count":369,"score":89.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482423,"topic_slug":"shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal/482423/3","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3486394,"name":"Totally out of touch","username":"AdamHeard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adamheard/{size}/195262_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T03:48:51.797Z","cooked":"

In multiple seasons I‚Äôve stacked spacers or used another device to limit the travel of a cylinder and no inspector ever said anything‚Ä¶ Clamping with a shaft collar is a bit borderline perhaps, but you can easily achieve the same effect with spacers.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T03:48:51.797Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":346,"readers_count":345,"score":104.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482423,"topic_slug":"shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal","display_username":"Totally out of touch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3609,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal/482423/4","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3486399,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T03:55:02.037Z","cooked":"

Any particular reason you can‚Äôt just use a shorter cylinder and/or change the mount points?

I mean, besides the obvious ‚Äúdesign is in flux‚Äù or ‚Äúit would take too long to get a new cylinder‚Äù or ‚Äúit‚Äôd break the design‚Äù.

Now that we‚Äôve solved the legality, I‚Äôm just trying to see if there‚Äôs a design improvement that could be made.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T03:55:02.037Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":323,"readers_count":322,"score":94.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482423,"topic_slug":"shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal/482423/5","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3486402,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T03:57:27.271Z","cooked":"

You can also always split tubing lengthwise to pop over the rod and toss a zip tie or two on it to keep it closed up.

Then you can pull it off, cut to length, reattach.

Mcmaster has a product like this, but I cant find it.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T03:57:34.697Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":291,"readers_count":290,"score":98.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482423,"topic_slug":"shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Flyin' a hull |5934‚Üê2451‚Üê2767‚Üê876"},"post_url":"/t/shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal/482423/6","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3486404,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T03:58:10.863Z","cooked":"

I think if we just read the text on the rules,

Skyehawk:

don‚Äôt use a set screw style as it will gall the rod

image1000√ó1000 44.5 KB

AdamHeard:

Clamping with a shaft collar is a bit borderline perhaps

image1600√ó1600 157 KB

It gives me the feel that as long as nothing is being drilled into the tube itself, it sounds like legal.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T03:58:10.863Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":272,"readers_count":271,"score":129.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482423,"topic_slug":"shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal/482423/7","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3486415,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T04:07:08.554Z","cooked":"

found it:

mcmaster.com

McMaster-Carr

McMaster-Carr is the complete source for your plant with over 595,000 products. 98% of products ordered ship from stock and deliver same or next day.

What simple things do you do to make your robot 1% better? General Forum
Core programming team members and mentors all get a flashdrive prior to an event that contains all installables needed to run our robot as well as other teams‚Äô robots. Includes a zip of our competition tagged commit, all wpilib, vscode, NI game tools, etc etc installers and offline files. Each flashdrive is meant to be labeled with user‚Äôs name and date of latest update. Especially useful for events that have no cell service or wifi. A large pack like this usually does the trick https://a.co/d‚Ä¶
","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T04:07:08.554Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":255,"readers_count":254,"score":91.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482423,"topic_slug":"shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.mcmaster.com/8672K59/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"McMaster-Carr","clicks":46},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/what-simple-things-do-you-do-to-make-your-robot-1-better/454617/12","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"What simple things do you do to make your robot 1% better?","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Flyin' a hull |5934‚Üê2451‚Üê2767‚Üê876"},"post_url":"/t/shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal/482423/8","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3486417,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T04:08:25.435Z","cooked":"

Feels like this it‚Äôs a part worth 3d printing. Especially if a fixed lenth is determined.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T04:09:08.217Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":249,"readers_count":248,"score":49.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482423,"topic_slug":"shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal/482423/9","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3487437,"name":"Everett33","username":"Everett33","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/everett33/{size}/5027_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-19T15:24:16.856Z","cooked":"

If you are 3D printing spacers, design them in a ‚ÄúC‚Äù shape so you can snap them on and off of the rod, so you can adjust the retract position in a more robust way on the fly.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-01-19T15:24:16.856Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":217,"readers_count":216,"score":43.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482423,"topic_slug":"shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal","display_username":"Everett33","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14765,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5660 - Head Coach"},"post_url":"/t/shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal/482423/10","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3487443,"name":"Richard Wallace","username":"Richard_Wallace","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/richard_wallace/{size}/110760_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-19T15:31:17.657Z","cooked":"

If the collar slips on the shaft, allowing it to retract more than your mechanism design intended, will there be an unsafe consequence?

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-01-19T15:31:17.657Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":210,"readers_count":209,"score":47.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482423,"topic_slug":"shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal","display_username":"Richard Wallace","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1549,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I live for the details."},"post_url":"/t/shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal/482423/11","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3684992,"name":"garyk","username":"garyk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/garyk/{size}/113200_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-19T23:50:16.783Z","cooked":"

Are you planning to adjust the stroke length at competition? Can you not determine this before? You‚Äôre creating a hard-stop with the shaft, why not put the hard-stop - maybe an adjustable one - on the bot itself?

I don‚Äôt see anything in the rules to prevent this, but I‚Äôd also be concerned about the ‚Äúcollar‚Äù slipping, or be damaged from being slammed. It‚Äôs legal to use another pressure regulator, downstream from the first regulator, to create a lower working pressure to keep it from slamming. Please see Reefcape R808.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-07-19T23:58:28.485Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":173,"readers_count":172,"score":34.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482423,"topic_slug":"shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal","display_username":"garyk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":1549,"username":"Richard_Wallace","name":"Richard Wallace","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/richard_wallace/{size}/110760_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7232,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal/482423/12","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3685036,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-20T00:51:36.616Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôm in general agreement with most of the posts.

  1. I don‚Äôt recall any rules making it illegal
  2. but it‚Äôs a bad idea.

Expanding #2,

  • A set screw or any slippage of the collar could damage the shaft, keeping it from working properly in what (in my experience) isn‚Äôt recoverable, or at least is less expensive to replace than repair if time isn‚Äôt critical. I wouldn‚Äôt want to test this at competition.
  • I‚Äôve presumed that the internals of the cylinder and the piston (that is, the moving piece inside the cylinder essentially the same size as the inside bore as the cylinder) are engineered to be a hard stop in reasonable use cases, and haven‚Äôt been disappointed. I have no confidence that whatever face contains the shaft end nor the shaft is engineered for this.

Suggestions for certain cases:

If the shaft collar choice is driven to adjust a prototype, take the weight hit and put the stop fully adjustable against the actual load of the cylinder for prototyping. After you have the geometry dialed in, make lightweight parts that do not impact random parts of the cylinder. Or, accept that your prototype cylinder is an expendable part and be ready to replace it if it gets damaged, perhaps several times. How much is in your wallet?

If you can‚Äôt put the stress points off of the cylinder, put them on the mounting threads rather than random faces. Use enough nuts such that your stop hits nuts threaded along the full length of the threads (or at least 5 turns) rather than a part of the cylinder.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-07-20T00:58:46.307Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":146,"readers_count":145,"score":54.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482423,"topic_slug":"shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal","display_username":"Gus Michel II","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Somebody Else ‚¨õüü´üü•üüßüü®üü©üü¶üü™‚ñí‚ñí‚¨ú "},"post_url":"/t/shaft-collar-on-pneumatic-cylinder-is-this-legal/482423/13","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3685105,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-20T02:18:25.455Z","cooked":"

Counter point, an aluminum clamping shaft collar is very unlikely to damage a hardened steel shaft, and on most cylinders all the collar is going to hit when retracting is the end of the mounting thread. A feature with no delicate geometry, designed to hold the load of the cylinder.

I‚Äôd much rather look at electrical alternatives, but if you‚Äôre going to use pneumatics, an aluminum clamping collar is a great way to get fine control on stroke.

I‚Äôve known about hardness and what can scratch what since at most ten years old, courtesy of DD, a rock hound and one of my father‚Äôs ham radio protegees (IIRC, WA5TYJ in the early 70‚Äôs). DD taught me enough geology by my early teens to tutor someone through a freshman college geology course over a decade later with just a little bit of catch up reading. That‚Äôs mostly where I learned how rocks ended up being where they ended up being. Water, tectonics, and glaciers, o my!
But mentoring and inspecting FRC, I‚Äôve learned that if the impact is hard enough, especially if it‚Äôs not in the expected direction, the usual rules of what scratches what don‚Äôt apply.
